title: Laws of Reflection
description: The angle of incidence equals the angle of reflection. The incident ray, reflected ray, and the normal all lie in the same plane.
tooltip: This is why you see a clear image in a calm lake!

title: Spherical Mirrors
description: Curved mirrors that form images by reflection. Concave mirrors converge light, while convex mirrors diverge it.
tooltip: Used in car headlights (concave) and side-view mirrors (convex).

title: Laws of Refraction (Snell's Law)
description: Light bends when it passes from one medium to another. The ratio of the sines of the angles of incidence and refraction is constant.
tooltip: This is why a straw in a glass of water looks bent.

title: Spherical Lenses
description: Transparent materials with curved surfaces that form images by refraction. Convex lenses converge light, concave lenses diverge it.
tooltip: The core of cameras, telescopes, and eyeglasses.
